result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If successfully completes agreement, State will file a stipulation amending Ct 1 to a county ordinance 2.1.2 and fine of $100 plus costs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. April C. Kuklinski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant April C. Kuklinski in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:11 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Matter was on the calendar for a ptc but the parties have reached a resolution of the case.

Address of Defendant is verified.

Defendant will plead to Count 1. 
Count 2 and Count 3 will be dismissed and read in.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Atty Halverson concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson  for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Victim is not requesting any restitution.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to WITHOLD ENTRY OF Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Battery, Misdemeanor as a domestic
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court prior to sentencing, feels this is an appropriate resolution.
Atty Halverson addresses the Court prior to sentencing, this is a joint recommendation.

Court will follow recommendations of the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Court approves the Deferred Prosecution Agreement
12 Months Deferred period
At the end of 12 months, if Defendant succesfully completes agreement, State will file a stipuation amending Count 1 to a county ordinance 2.1.2 and request a fine of $100 plus costs.

Bond posted is to be kept and applied towards the ordinance fine. Balance to be paid within 60 days or set up payment plan

Agreement is handed back to the State for copies, will be filed today at the Clerk of Courts office
Pre-trial conference on May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant April C. Kuklinski in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.
